Die guten und die b√∂sen Geister It's a bit simple, but so far I've found nothing similar to replace it with. Speakeasy maybe, but we gifted that one away.
Warhammer: Invasion + all expansions except Legends, with some packs twice. Verborgende K√∂nigreiche Bought for 10‚Ç¨(!) at Essen 2015. Kataklysmus Bought for 10‚Ç¨(!) at Essen 2017.

Colt Express Bought for 27‚Ç¨. Bandits Bought all six together at Essen 2018 for 30‚Ç¨.

Star Realms + Colony Wars (2nd Base set) + Storage Box

7 Wonders: Duel 2p version of 7 Wonders. Bought at Essen 2015.
Shuffle Heroes Bought at Essen 2015 for 15‚Ç¨.
Clacks: A Discworld Board Game Similar to "The Signs Are Right!". Bought at Essen 2015.
...and then, we held hands. Coop about a relationship. Bought at Essen 2015.
Specter Ops Bought at Essen 2015 for 40‚Ç¨.
Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn + Expansion 1 & 2 Expansion 3: The Song of Soaksend + The Laws of Lions
Hey, danke f√ºr den Fish! / "Hey, that's my fish!"‚Ç¨7 at Essen 2016.
Terraforming Mars Sleeved and w/ FS-TER organiser from Folded Space (https://www.foldedspace.net/store/terraforming-mars/)

Stak Bots‚Ç¨20 w/ both expansions (Yellow, Red) at Essen 2017

Kami-sama 45‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018. Kami-sama: Spirit Way Expansion $8. Ordered with All Manor of Evil Kami-sama: The Awakened Stretch Goal Expansion $12. Ordered with All Manor of Evil
Sub Terra English Edition. ? at Essen 2018
Ganymede Would have been 25‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018 but was sold out. Ordered from publisher's website.
The Royal Game of Ur British Museum edition
Ecogon: Stille Wasser Would have been 28‚Ç¨, but bought in bundle at Essen 2019.
Fish & Flips Bought in bundle at Essen 2019.
Draftosaurus EUR 20‚Ç¨ at Essen 2019. Spanish Edition.

It's a Wonderful World 39‚Ç¨ at Essen 2019. French Edition.

list.name: New games played this year
list.g: Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Kami-sama: The Awakened Stretch Goal Expansion
Lovelace & Babbage Real-time number-adding. Only one person can play as Ada :(
Ambrosia Stacks of bees flying around in a circle! I liked it, but we didn't end up buying it.
On the Origin of Species EUR 32.00 at Essen 2019, but sold out. I liked it, but everyone else was super-tired.
Oh, Fox! Hidden roles, hidden movement
Crimson Company Tight 2p game in a fantasy-medieval setting
Isle of Pan Nice art, but too light for us.
It's a Wonderful World Excellent drafting game. 1‚Äì5p.
Potemkin Empire Exactly what the title promises: Build fa√ßades and pretend you have certain buildings.
Fast Sloths / "Faultier" Quite nice, but not that deep.
Black Angel Very nice. Much better use of the mechanic from Solenia last year. Quite pricy, but great components. We didn't buy it mostly because we alraeady had a lot of games at this point.
Pigasus Quickly match various chimera. Great fun, but not the kind of game we'd want to own.
TEAM3 Great party-game, but needs exactly 3 players.
Wangdo / The Way of the BearReally cute bear pieces, but too predictable.
Spring on a String Based on a unique mechanism of pulling laces through textile. Very compact.
Project L Build up a pool up tetris blocks to complete bigger and bigger goals. They had no copies to sell at Essen 2019.
Welkin Order-fulfillment and market-manipulation with beautiful art. Not different enough from other games we have.
Hats Card-swapping game similar to Thor / Botswana
Aquatica Building an undersea kingdom with a rising-cards mechanism. We would have bought it, but it was sold out. EUR 45.00 at Essen 2019.
Sarah's Vision Co-op w/ Jenga elements. The theme give me strong vibes of "3%". We won our first game, so it's not a co-op we need to have.
Moon Base Cool looking 2p abstract where you place rings on top of each other. Sold out at Essen 2019. :(

list.name: Ordered/Backed
list.g: Vast: The Crystal Caverns 50‚Ç¨. Ordered with Seize the Bean
Kodama 3D KS. Nov 2019. Plus playmat. Shipping paid. No address entered. https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2012515236/kodama-3d-0

list.name: Not bought at Essen (but wanted to)
Watchlist
list.g: Hostage Negotiator / Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave Solo
Imhotep: Das Duell Excellent 2p adaption. 17‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018.
Fury of Dracula FFG 3rd Edition is out. https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/news/2015/7/23/fury-of-dracula/
Pixel Tactics Pixel Tactics 2 is the newest incarnation.
The Duke Chess-like abstract with cool movement.
Hawken Real-Time Card Game Asymetrical Mecha combat
Fauna, Anachronism Mentioned on DiceTower as being educating.
Fidelitas Green Couch Games, Jason Kotarski. Missed Kickstarter (2014).
NanoBot Battle Arena Derpy Games, LLC; Benji Michalek. Kickstarter (2014).
Omen: A Reign of War 2p card game.
Cosmogenesis Throw rocks at your planets to make moons

list.name: Games we lost access to that I miss
Games I like but don't own
New games played in 2018
list.g: Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
The Forgotten City Nice game and artwork, but confusing graphic design
Reef 40‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018. German edition by Pegasus Spiele.
War Chest Was nice, but not 40‚Ç¨ nice.
Carpe Diem Excellent Feld. 40‚Ç¨. Sold out at Essen 2018.
Solenia Day/Night cycle. Cards with holes in them. 36‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018.
Orbis Nice God-game. Works well with 2p. Deeper than Splendor. 30‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018. Not as good as Ga√Øa, though.
Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig 35‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018. Better than B2C, but no replacement for 2p CoMKL. Good with bigger groups.
Debtzilla We just sort-of played a turn
Cryptocurrency Stock-trading game. Surprisingly fun. Didn't like it as much as Wongamania or Hab und Gut.
Athens Crap game with some potential. They should have worked on improving it instead of publishing it.
Ganymede Was called "Lighter than Splendor" but I don't think so. Would have been 25‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018 but was sold out.
Discovery: The Era of Voyage I think this is a good game if you use the actual rules instead of the confusing nonsense that was explained to us.
Fine Sand Was ok, not not super exciting. 28‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018
Fast Forward: FORTUNE Bought as a gift.
Imhotep: Das Duell Excellent 2p adaption. 17‚Ç¨ at Essen 2018.

Roll for Adventure Waaay to easy co-op. Won with many turns to spare and before the "big bad" even came out. None of the more "difficult" options looked like they fundamentally change something about the difficulty.

list.name: New games played in 2017
list.g: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game
Exploding Kittens Russian Roulette with silly cards
Welcome Back to the Dungeon Slight variant on WttD, still a sub-par dungeon crawler
Fast Forward: FLEE Played it, bought it. :)
Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Sol: Last Days of a Star

list.name: New games played in 2016
list.g: The Reef Worst 2p KOSMOS game I've played so far.
Abraca...what? Sort-of like a competative Hanabi.
The Isle of Doctor Necreaux Nice coop. Won on second run.
Sapiens Quite a lot of downtime. Should try with 2p.
Dino Race Silly racing game seemingly inspired by Odin's Raven.
CS Files / Deception: Murder in Hong Kong
Tiny Epic Kingdoms 5p seemed too take too long. Tiny fiddly bits.
Lost Cities: The Board Game The original game is better, and more thematic.
Welcome to the Dungeon There are better Dungeon-Delvers.
Through the Desert Knizia classic. I like Kingdom Builder better.
Carcassonne: Expansion 1 ‚Äì Inns & Cathedrals One of the better expansions. Makes it more swingy, but also leads to some interesting decisions.
Nefarious donaldx game about Mad Scientists (all male)
Flip City Deckbuilding Push-your-luck with double-sided cards. Good for 2p. Was on Kickstarter.
Burrows A game about people complaining about gophers. Good mechanics, odd theme.
BraveRats A bit like Strife, but less mind-melting.
Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
The Vampire, the Elf and the Cthulhu Writers battling over the contents of a novel
Colony Nice game, artwork not my cup of tea
Colt Express: Marshal & Prisoners ‚Ç¨20 at Essen 2016
Fabled Fruit / "Fabelsaft" Changes after each play
Dungeon of Fortune German version. ‚Ç¨20 at Essen 2016.
Vikings Gone Wild More in-your face deck builder
Macroscope Picture guessing game w/ interesting device and 400 pictures.
Days of Ire: Budapest 1956 Can be played as Coop or Asymetrical
Terraforming Mars Sold out at Essen 2016
HMS Dolores Iterated Prisoner's Dilemma by Bruno Faidutti, Eric M. Lang
4 Gods Simultaneous tile-laying game where you decide what god you are during the game
La Glace et le Ciel Coop based on a documentary

list.name: New games played in 2015
list.g: Trains Deckbuilder with a board. Have to try to get Anne to play it.
Lost Legacy: Flying Garden Played with 3p. Seemed more chaotic than "The Starship".
Lifeboats Too much of a "social" game for my taste.
Betrayal at the House on the Hill
Armad√∂ra Ok little abstract. Execution seems lacking.
V√∂lusp√° Very nice tile-laying game. Anne won, of course.
Fungi Shrooms! With butter! Yummy! (Anne wasn't as impressed as I)
Star Fluxx Pretty random. Huge downtime on other players turns.
Jolly Roger 2015. Very chaotic and swingy.
Riff Raff Dexterity game. I won. :)
A Fistful of Penguins Simple Push-Your-Luck dice (manipulation) game. Purple Penguins.
Tides of Time 2p drafting game with 18 cards.
Flick 'em Up Dexterity Western game with tons of scenarios.
Champions of Midgard Mythical-Viking worker placement where your warriors are dice.
ExoPlanets Kickstarter. Planets! Life! Multiple Chip Use! Hidden Goals!!! Oh my1!!1 (Rahdo thinks it's too aggressive). 35‚Ç¨ at Essen 2015.
Favor of the Pharaoh Dice manipulation game. 45‚Ç¨ at Essen 2015.
Dice City What the dice do changes based on the board. 35‚Ç¨ at Essen 2015.
Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn40‚Ç¨ at Essen 2015.
Impulse Horrific rulebook. Small 4X game. I liked it, Anne didn't. :(
Penguin Reiner Knizia's typical troubles with theme. This is like "Westeros Intrique", but with a pointless dexterity component.
Ga√Øa Very cool "God-game" with nice artwork.
Wrong Chemistry Horrible execution, but the underlying game has potential.
Gum Gum Machine Rube Goldberg machine produces gum gums. I had a hard time with the memory element.

list.name: New games played in 2014
list.g: Arler Erde / Fields of Arle Took ages but was very nice. Second play was quicker, especially the setup using labeled bags.
Castles of Burgundy Very nice Euro where dice determine availale actions. Managable component count. Some downtime with 4p. Try 2p?
Ticket to Ride: Europe Played with 5p.
Star Realms Great Dominion-like 2p where you attack each other with space-ships. Quite different from Core Worlds.
Panic Station Crap. Terrible theme, nothing makes sense. The game itself might be okayish with some proper explanation/rules. Not gonna give it another chance, though.
Witch's Brew Role-selection, multiple card-use game about brewing potions. Some art is really nice, some hard to see. Reprint coming?
Ascension: Cronicles of the Godslayer Less strategic Dominion-clone. Rather play the original.
Ninja Dice Dungeon Roll is the better Push-your-luck, since it has tougher decisions.
Snake Oil Fun party game about pitching utter nonsene to customers
Spellcasters Captures some of the essence of Magic. Works with 2p or more.
Versailles Don't judge a game by its cover! Fast-flowing "worker-movement" game. 30‚Ç¨. Not bought.
Machi Koro Build city, roll for income. I liked it. Christoph bought. Rahdo thinks not a good 2p.
Orongo Nice theme (Moai-building) for a Knizia. 2-4p. 38‚Ç¨(?).
Alchemists Publishing theories about alchemical ingredients. Uses a mobile phone to resolve randomized potion mixing. 40‚Ç¨ at Essen 2014. Not bought.
Viceroy Building a pyramid of white guys. Kinda ok, but rather boring.
Progress: Evolution of Technology The one with the multiple card uses reviewed by Rahdo. 35‚Ç¨.
Kingsport Festival Kingsburg with HPL theme! Theme is a lot more fun than pseudo-fantasy Kingsburg. Not great, though. So maybe wait for the mechanic to crop up in a better game?
H√∂y√ºk Replaces Carc for Rahdo. We had a really bad explanation at Essen 2014 and didn't like it at all.
Bakerspeed Crap. No deduction. Speed is way better at matching fast.
Boggle Flash Good exercise for Scrabble :)
Red November Drunken Gnomes trying to fix a submarine. 'Nuff said.
Infinite City Crap. Very random tile-laying game. Offers nothing over Carc and Suburbia.
Glen More Played without much explanation. Might still be good. Has an interesting Rondell-mechanic.
Splendor Very nice heavy gem tokens. I need to get better to beat Anne.
Westeros Intrique Nice tile-laying game, but like all Knizia's it's hardly connected to the theme.
Pandemic: Contagion Pandemic-themed non-coop card-based area-control where you play as diseases.
Thor / Botswana Both are the same game.
Mai-Star Should also work well with 2p.
Arcana We only played the 1st edition. I would really like to take a look at the 2011 revised version by FFG
8 Minute Empire: Legends Nicer art and pieces
The Three Little Pigs Anne refuses to play this again.
Carcassonne incl. Abbey and Mayor and ?
Confusion We were underwhelmed... plus it's super-expensive
The Empire Engine First the Print'n'Play, then bought the edition by AEG at Essen.
